titleInfo.title: Letter, Nathan Crawford in Columbia, Tenn., to Rachel Crawford in Kansasville, Wis.

mods.abstract: In this letter to his sister Rachel, Nathan Crawford discusses family matters, his health and the health of other soldiers from his hometown, troop movements, the battle of Pittsburgh Landing (known more commonly as the Battle of Shiloh), and his opinion that his sister would have made an excellent soldier. Crawford also asks his sister and the rest of his family to write often. Nathan was killed on 19 September 1863 at Chickamauga. Rachel married Miles Trowbridge on 22 February 1869 and died in Portland, Oregon, on 6 February 1900.

titleInfo.title: Union Soldier's Letter regarding the Battle of Shiloh
